Description: The attention towards innate immune cells and their receptors has surged, presenting as promising alternatives to conventional abT cells. During the discussion, Dr. Katy Rezvani will explore new engineered NK cell designs and novel combination therapies emerging from ongoing clinical trials. Dr. Jurgen Kuball will delve into the latest insights in g9d2T cell biology, highlighting how this knowledge shapes the creation of engineered immune cells and bispecific engagers utilizing defined gdT cell receptors. Additionally, Dr. Michel Klichinsky will expand upon the recent clinical data involving engineered macrophages, shedding light on innovative designs based on these insights.
Location: Ballroom 6 A - Upper Level - Convention Center
SearchResultBody: SY45. Engineering Strategies Based on NK, and gd T Cells and Their Receptors, and Macrophages

Title: Engineering Strategies Based on NK, and gd T Cells and Their Receptors, and Macrophages
